attributes.action: A new national medal to recognise NHS staff who helped the UK overcome Covid-19.
attributes.additional_details:
Previous generations have, at times of war, celebrated the valour, service and sacrifice of those who fought to defend the nation through the awarding of campaign medals.

Covid-19 is a national emergency which has placed the UK on a war-like footing.

A thankful nation wishes to celebrate and recognise all the NHS workers, including those who have come out of retirement, who have tended the sick under such challenging conditions.

A medal would be a permanent reminder of the nation's gratitude.
attributes.background: A nationwide competition should be launched to design a new medal that will be awarded to all NHS staff - from surgeons, GPs and nurses through to lab technicians and porters - who, collectively, worked with such dedication, compassion and skill to see the nation through the Covid-19 crisis in 2020.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/302613

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

NHS website: https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/
UK Government website: https://www.gov.uk/coronavirus

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips

You may also be interested to know that because of the large number of petitions that have been started in relation to coronavirus, the Petitions Committee has been questioning the Government about its response to the coronavirus outbreak.

Find out more and watch the Committee put questions suggested by petitioners to Government Ministers and the Deputy Chief Medical Officer: https://committees.parliament.uk/committee/326/petitions-committee/news/145767/committee-question-deputy-chief-medical-officer-and-ministers-on-coronavirus-response/

Read letters asking further questions of Government Ministers: https://committees.parliament.uk/committee/326/petitions-committee/publications/3/correspondence/
